results.title: Jean de Florette
results.creator_credit: Claude Berri, Gerard Brach and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: Lavish film version of Marcel Pagnol’s tale of a simple man who leaves the city to live on an inherited piece of land but is ruined when he fails to find water to irrigate his property because the location of an underground spring is kept secret from him by two scheming villagers who wish to take over the farm. The conclusion to this story comes in the sequel, “Manon des Sources”. “Jean de Florette” stars Yves Montand and Gerard Depardieu.

results.title: Jean Cocteau: Autoportrait D'un Inconnu
results.brief_description:
In this ‘first person’ documentary, Edgardo Cozarinsky uses a long interview with Cocteau who recounts the intellectual life in Paris at the turn of the XXth Century, as well that the birth of the ‘Avant-guarde’ movement with ‘Les ballet Russes’ and the uproar that accompanied the staging of ‘Parade’.

Credits: Producer, Carole Weisweiller ; director, Edgardo Cozarinsky ; writers, Edgardo Cozarinsky, Carole Weisweiller.

results.title: Jean-Pierre Melville Cineaste
results.brief_description:
This short film follows Jean-Pierre Melville during the filming of ‘The Shadow Army’. Melville explains his interest in WWII which stems from his involvement in the Resistance movement and later on led to his filming an adaptation of ‘Le Silence de la Mer’. He confides his fascination for American cinema where action matters first and foremost.

Credits: Director, Jacques Dupont.

results.title: Jean's fugue
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows the activities at a Summer Music School at Cambridge. The intensive work and casual fun make the fortnight at Cambridge University benefit both the individual musician and the music world.

results.title: Jealousy = Pebhoot
results.creator_credit: Todor Dinov and State Distribution Centre
results.brief_description: Animation using musical notation whereby the stave represents the ground and groups of notes have the appearance of horses and riders, after the style of the traditional western. Includes a sequence when a treble clef is seized for use as a lassoo.

results.title: Jealousy
results.brief_description: An absorbing program, hosted by psychologists Peter Quarry, in which people talk about their jealousy - how they felt, what they did and why. A private investigator, police and psychologists discuss how jealousy can lead to violence and present strategies for coping with it.
results.description: An absorbing program, hosted by psychologists Peter Quarry, in which people talk about their jealousy - how they felt, what they did and why. A private investigator, police and psychologists discuss how jealousy can lead to violence and present strategies for coping with it.

results.title: Je
results.creator_credit: Louis Portugais, Leonard Forest and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An experiment in modern creative dancing in which a mime of self discovery is expressed in body movements with accompanying sounds. As the movements express awakening, thought and feeling, the sounds change from sounds of nature to marching feet and atomic explosions. Dance: Suzanne Rivest. Camera: Francois Seguillon. Sound arrangement: Maurice Blackburn.

results.title: Jazzoo [Short version]
results.brief_description: Illustrates the beauty, colour and activities of a zoo in the early hours of a summer morning. This film illustrates how the filmmaker uses his basic resource - the visual image - without the use of words.

results.title: Jazzoo
results.creator_credit: John Camie and Tee Pee Productions
results.brief_description: Designed to capture the beauty, colour and activities of a zoo in the early hours of a summer morning, with striking visual images and a lively, original jazz score. Photographed at the St Louis Zoo, we watch the animals commence their day, and their encounters with the early spectators.

results.title: Jazz on a summer's day
results.brief_description: A classic film for lovers of jazz music, “Jazz On A Summer’s Day” documents the Newport Jazz Festival of 1958, which ranged from Anita O’Day’s sassy rendition of ‘Sweet Georgia Brown’ to the powerful spirituality of Mahalia Jackson’s great gospel singing. Director Bert Stern chose to not merely show the performers on stage, but to fuse the music with images of the festival as whole, giving a sense and feel of the whole event. Includes music performed by Louis Armstrong, Mahalia Jackson, Anita O’Day, Gerry Mulligan, Dina Washington, George Shearing, Chuck Berry and Thelonius Monk.
